title: Which is the correct sentence, 'Every two pictures contain one question' or ' Every two pictures contains one question'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which is the correct sentence, "Every two pictures contain one question" or " Every two pictures contains one question"? I have never heard of this saying before. The closest is, “Every picture tells a story”, which is nowhere near to this. It must lose something in translation because I can make no sense of it in English. Why is it two pictures, why not one or three? What type of question? If I wanted to make it sound more idiomatic I would rephrase it as something like: Every two pictures gives rise to a single question.

Every and each with singular or plural nouns require singular verb only but plural nouns + each follows plural verb. Eg: Every two pictures contains…(here two pictures is a unit) The two pictures each contain… Each men has an ability . Men of each have an ability.
